reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arriving in Bergamo for 2 nights after the end of a week on Lake Como, we thought we would be out of superlatives for beautiful views but the drive up into the Citta Alta was just breathtaking. Bergamo is truly a gem of a city and this hotel is superly placed to explore it. Parking is a little tricky, we didn't realise that we could even pull up outside the hotel and by chance ended up in a car park where a helpful attendant told us what to do. To be fair, the fact that you are allowed to park for free in one of the most central locations in the city is a bonus, and the hotel will give you a voucher to place in front of your car which you can then leave for the whole of your stay. It is a 5 minute walk from the hotel to the nearest car park and yes the streets are cobbled but it is part of the charm and if you are not up for some walking when visiting Bergamo then you have come to the wrong place!
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, perfect location, exquisite city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel owners are really friendly and did their best to make us feel at home despite the language barrier (which was totally our own fault given our appallingly limited Italian). Our room was on the first floor and it was large and tastefully furnished with tea/coffee, flatscreen TV and a good choice of toiletries. It was very quiet during the day and at night. Contrary to the other review, our aircon worked perfectly and kept our room blissfully cool throughout the entire stay.
reviews.title: Air Conditioning between 77 and 90 degrees

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What really makes this hotel is the location though, once you have checked in, you literally step outside into the heart of a simply beautiful historical city. There is so much to do and you could spend hours just gazing in the windows of the little shops lining the streets or settling down for a prosecco in one of the bars lining the streets. We ate in 2 restaurants both of which were excellent and good value, Damimo for pizza and Donizetti for salads, cheese and meat platters (and an excellent wine list). (Both are on the main street but I would recommend booking for Donizetti as it is very popular).
reviews.title: This was our best hotel experience in Italy

reviews.text: I am so excited to have discovered Bergamo and this hotel is really in keeping with the character of the city so is a perfect place to stay.
reviews.title: Ideal location and lots of character
WONDERFUL PIAZZA VECCHIA
reviews.text: The Citta Alta of Bergamo blew me away! Come here and you will be transported back in time to a beautiful medieval town. Stay at the Hotel Piazza Vecchia and enjoy--for the most part--modern conveniences, a comfortable bed, a great shower, and a good breakfast (apparently improved since some negative reviews of past years) all in the very heart of the Citta Alta. What more could one want? Well, one could want air conditioning on a hot day that actually works. We stayed in room 12, a top level room that cost 180 euros with payment required in advance of arrival. There was an air conditioning control that at first appeared to work. But I could never get it to set below 25C, or 77 degrees F. When I inquired I was told that the A/C was adjustable, but only between 25C and 32C. "You cannot change it because it is set by the computer," I was told. Give me a break!!! I was certainly happy to know that I could opt for setting the A/C at 90F! And just who sets the computer other than management? Fortunately, late in the day of the one day we were there, storms in the distance blew some cooler breezes, so we opened the door to the balcony and the small window that looked out to the mountains and were able to cool the room down for a while. But when we went to sleep, we closed the door and the window since we had heard so many stories and about mosquitoes and other insects in Italy coming into rooms at night. And by next morning the temperature in the room was again 77 degrees.

reviews.title: Wonderful renovated palazzo
reviews.text: We just spent 3 days in Bergamo at this hotel. We had a large room with wood beams in the ceiling. Very convenient if you are spending time in the Alta Citta. Walking distance to everything. Parking is provided but it is a bit tricky finding a spot. We would come back here.

reviews.title: very unfriendly experience.
reviews.text: We have just returned from a wonderful holiday in Italy but our final 3 days in this hotel rank as one of our most unpleasant hotel stays ever in our travelling times. The predominant feeling is this establishment wants your money but does not want to deal with you as a person in any way however small or basic your request (including I observed one couple's attempt at how to use the electricity). We complained at checkout but were ignored and left with a horrible feeling of hostility towards us. Please there are lots of lovely other places in this beautiful city think very hard about staying there.

reviews.title: Phantastically renovated old town house !
reviews.text: Phantastically renovated old town palace, excellent combination of modern architecture with centuries old stones. Lots of flair! Rooms are nicely furnished, stylish bathrooms. Breakfast is good, for Italy (italians usually just have a coffee and a croissant) it's excellent! Location absolutely perfect.

reviews.title: ideal location
reviews.text: If you want to be able to pop in and out of the old part of bergamo this hotel is ideally placed. There is a steep staircase [with stair lift] from the main door on the pedestrianised street to the reception desk with an interior lift serving the upper floors. It is a quiet hotel with no bar/shared lounge space.The continental breakfast was more than sufficient for most folk. Perhaps it is the sterling/euro exchange rate but I felt it was a little pricey for an above average small hotel but this was more than compensated by the superb location.

reviews.title: Triple room- beware!
reviews.text: Have just returned from a lovely 5 day break in the Citta Alta in Bergamo.Had a triple room on the first floor of the Palazzo Vecchia, but felt the price of £ 180/ night was excessive. We had no internet access, or satellite channels as described in the hotel's own website, (which mattered more as the weather was poor). I should have asked for a reduced rate. Our room was certainly very clean and spacious.The bathroom was similarly sizeable,and modern , but not quite as classy as those shown online.Toiletries were satisfactory rather than luxurious.

reviews.title: Bizarre place in a stunning town
reviews.text: As others have written this hotel has some very strong plusses. The location is absolutely fantastic - literally on one of the most beautiful and bustling little streets in the old town and just steps from Piazza Vecchia and lots of lovely restaurants. When we arrived we were greeted by the young lady who I gather is the owner's daughter. She was polite if rather cold and showed us to our room without ever really smiling or asking us anything. No problem at all though, to be honest we're not ones for chatting to everyone on holiday and this didn't really bother us. We also didn't have breakfast owing to reviews so can't comment on that. When the time came for checking out this time the older man dealt with us and processed our payment, again without a flicker of a smile or a question as to whether everything was OK. We then had to get someone's attention (which took some time) to ask where we could leave our bags as our plane didn't leave until later. None of this really bothered me and we put it down to surliness. When we came back to get out bags however we were really annoyed. I wanted to ask the young woman to call us a taxi as there didn't seem to be too many about on a Sunday but she was just stood behind reception gossiping on the phone. We waited three or four minutes in front of her and she showed no sign at all of getting off the phone. So I said 'excuse me' and she put her fingers to her lips. I then heard her muttering on the phone about the 'inglese'. That was just too much so I started to ring the little reception desk bell in front of her which after about 5 rings and lots of hurrumphing from her finally seemed to do the trick and she reluctantly stopped her call. All this was rather ridiculous but it does sum up the total lack of concern that this hotel has for its guests. The staff remind me of staff in a Communist hotel in the 70s who have no interest or motivation to do their job. All very odd when the refurbishment as others have said is really quite nice. Our king size room was massive with a good 4 poster bed and a nice shower. It certainly wasn't luxurious but it was comfortable though a bit cold with the stone, uncarpetted floors and the lack of heating.

reviews.title: Magic holiday.
reviews.text: Despite my comments I would irritatingly stay here again simply because it is clearly the best hotel in a woefully under-served old town - we were so pleased we stayed in the old town as while the lower town is perfectly nice it is nowhere near as beautiful and the restaurants aren't as good. I do hope though that the hotel is taken over soon buy people who actually like having guests. In Bergamo I would definitely go up to beautiful San Viglio which is stunning and would highly recommend La Colombina, Da Mimmo and Il Sole. Not sure which one is the best as they were all gorgeous!

reviews.title: gem of a hotel
reviews.text: We have just returned from Bergarmo, staying at the hotel Piazza Vecchia. It could not have been better. Our room was clean, spacious and nicely furnished, the bathroom so perfectly Italian in design with lots of clean white towels, changed every day. Room 1 on the first floor had a covered terrace which we used quite often, a corkscrew was provided by the hotel.

reviews.title: Grumpy owners.
reviews.text: The management were all very nice, and on the few occasions we needed to bother them, mostly for weather reports for our two day trips they responed brilliantly.

reviews.title: Great place, fantastic location
reviews.text: We love breakfast on the street so didn't use their breakfast facility but everything looked fine. We were delighted to be presented with a bottle of wine on our departure.- First Class Hotel.

reviews.title: More satisfied Yorkshire people!
reviews.text: Perhaps people from Yorkshire are easily pleased (unlikely!), but we agree with everything Yorktravel has said. When we booked this hotel some months ago there were some reviews complaining about the "grumpy" owner but we didn't find that at all. He and the other staff were always obliging and friendly. I think it helps, by the way, if you at least try to speak Italian to Italians, rather than assume they will understand English. It shows willing and goes down well. Our plane didn't leave until the evening but the owner was very willing for us to leave our cases there all day until we were ready to go.

reviews.title: Lovely hotel, can't go wrong!
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed here last weekend for a romantic break and I would definately recommend it. The hotel's location is great, in the centre of the high town of Bergamo, right on a beautiful little winding street full of restaurants and small shops. The service was good, the girl who served us on the front desk spoke very good English (although the older man who I believe is the owner spoke very little English). We stayed in one of the cheaper comfort rooms, which was a very decent size and had a very modern stylish bathroom, and flat screen tv. The only thing missing was tea and coffee making facilities, but as we had breakfast included it wasn't really a problem. Breakfast was more than adequate, with croissants, tea/coffee, juice, a selection of cereal, yoghurt, bread and a variety of jams, cheeses and salami. Overall, we found the hotel clean, spacious and stylish, and good value for money, and would definately stay there again. The area is also beautiful, with some amazing restaurants and bakeries, and fantastic architecture.

reviews.title: Great location & hotel
reviews.text: Spent valentine's weekend here on a ryanair break & this hotel had very good reviews so decided to put it to the test. Arrived on thursday lunchtime & checked in no problems, i have no Italian but both girls at reception spoke english. Room was lovely - spotlessly clean, big & airy with a small balcony & plenty natural light with a view of the mountains & valleys. Bathroom was very big with a powerful shower & plenty space. Location couldn't be better as it's right in the old city, well worth the extra expense to stay up there as we found the newer city fairly bland. To be honest, you could just spend hours walking around there looking at the sights & stopping in the little bars & cafes.

reviews.title: Lovely hotel
reviews.text: Hotel staff were fine, hardly ever saw them to be honest which is what I like when i go away, we didn't have breakfast any morning in the hotel not beacuse of bad reports but it was simply nicer to go out to the local cafes & get something there.

reviews.title: Great little hotel
reviews.text: All in all, pretty close to perfect. a little pricey but as I said much better value overall than staying in the new town. I'll certainly be back at some stage.

reviews.title: one for the to do list in life !
reviews.text: I run 2 hotels in Venice and I am absolute beginner in using Trip advisor to write a review (I generally receive them concerning the stay of my clients). Now here I am finally on the other side!! Ah Ah!!
